greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of terms in the negaFibonacci representation of n (A215022).
comment: The Fibonacci numbers F(2*n) are the indices of records of this sequence.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The negaFibonacci representation of 3 is A215022(3) = 101, thus a(3) = 1 + 0 + 1 = 2.
mathematica: ind[n_] := Floor[Log[Abs[n]*Sqrt[5] + 1/2]/Log[GoldenRatio]]; f[1] = 1; f[n_] := If[n > 0, i = ind[n - 1]; If[EvenQ[i], i++]; i, i = ind[-n]; If[OddQ[i], i++]; i]; a[n_] := Module[{k = n, s = 0}, While[k != 0, i = f[k]; s += 1; k -= Fibonacci[-i]]; s]; Array[a, 100]
results.author: _Amiram Eldar_, Jan 08 2020
